subject: Nutrition
title: Mindful Eating
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mindful Eating.

hook.text: Eating while distracted makes you consume up to 50% more food without realizing it.

buildup.text: Mindful eating means paying attention to taste, texture, and hunger signals during meals.

discovery.text: Studies show mindful eaters digest better because the brain signals the gut to prepare for food.

twist.text: The cephalic phase starts before food enters your mouthâ€”seeing and smelling food triggers enzyme release.

climax.text: Simply eating slower and chewing thoroughly improves nutrient absorption and reduces bloating.

punchline.text: Paying attention to food improves how you digest it.

quiz.question: What is the cephalic phase of digestion?
options: When seeing or smelling food triggers enzyme release
